case_vignette:
A 50-year-old man comes to the physician for the evaluation of recurrent episodes of chest pain, difficulty breathing, and rapid heart beating over the past two months. During this period, he has had a 4-kg (8.8-lb) weight loss, malaise, pain in both knees, and diffuse muscle pain. Five years ago, he was diagnosed with chronic hepatitis B infection and was started on tenofovir. His temperature is 38°C (100.4°F), pulse is 110/min, and blood pressure is 150/90 mm Hg. Cardiopulmonary examination shows no abnormalities except for tachycardia. There are several ulcerations around the ankle and calves bilaterally. Laboratory studies show:
Hemoglobin 11 g/dL
Leukocyte count 14,000/mm3
Erythrocyte sedimentation rate 80 mm/h
Serum
Perinuclear anti-neutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies negative
Hepatitis B surface antigen positive
Urine
Protein +2
RBC 6-7/hpf
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?"

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Rheumatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having episodes of chest pain, difficulty breathing, and my heart feels like it's beating really fast.
Have you had any history of heart attacks or strokes?
No, I haven't had any heart attacks or strokes.
Have you been taking any medications for your heart?
No, I haven't been taking any medications for my heart.
Have you had any family history of heart disease?
I'm not aware of any family history of heart disease.
Have you had any other symptoms such as shortness of breath, dizziness, or nausea?
Yes, I've been experiencing shortness of breath along with the chest pain.
Have you had any history of asthma or other respiratory conditions?
No, I don't have a history of asthma or other respiratory conditions.
Have you had any history of high blood pressure or high cholesterol?
I haven't mentioned anything about high cholesterol, but my blood pressure was high at 150/90 mm Hg when checked.
Have you had any history of diabetes?
I haven't mentioned having diabetes.
Have you had any history of smoking or exposure to secondhand smoke?
I haven't mentioned any history of smoking or exposure to secondhand smoke.
Have you had any history of obesity?
No, I haven't mentioned any history of obesity.
Have you had any history of kidney disease?
I haven't mentioned any history of kidney disease.
Have you had any history of thyroid disease?
I haven't mentioned any history of thyroid disease.
Have you had any history of liver disease?
Yes, I was diagnosed with chronic hepatitis B infection five years ago.
Final Diagnosis: Myocardial Ischemia with Hepatitis B infection.

The patient denies any history of heart attacks, strokes, or medication use for heart conditions. There is no known family history of heart disease, asthma, or other respiratory conditions. However, the patient does report experiencing shortness of breath along with the chest pain. The patient's blood pressure was noted to be high at 150/90 mm Hg during a recent check. The patient also has a history of chronic hepatitis B infection diagnosed five years ago.
